page.title: 03Housing
page.content: Housing in Ashington is very mixed, comprising some ancient cottages and farmhouses and,at the other end of the scale, modern houses and bungalows. {Public Authority Housing. There are four sites comprising housing provided from the 1930's onwards by the local authorities - The Sands, Penn Gardens, Woelf's Close and Hillcrest Close (the last being blocks of flats for old people). Some houses have been purchased by sitting tenants under recent legislation. {Privately Built Housing.} Up to 1945 the village saw no dramatic changes, but the number of houses increased spectacularly after the Second World War. This new building introduced a population having a more urban than rural background. Several small estates have been built during the last twenty-six years.
